threads.title: Meetings database setup
threads.excerpt:
# Meetings database setup

**Date:** 2025-08-12

---

**User:** Fred, can you please help me map a new "Meetings" Database into my Notion HQ so that I can 1) store all meeting agendas, papers, minutes

threads.title: 2) Recording & transcription (now vs later)
threads.excerpt:
- Parse subject for **title + date** (fallback to email date).  
- Heuristics: If body contains “Agenda” → Agenda; attachments → Papers; “Minutes” → Minutes.  
- Extract participants from headers → At

threads.title: 4) Calendar sync (optional but handy)
threads.excerpt:
- Upsert into **Tasks**; relate back to **Meeting** and **Project**; set Area by inheritance (Meeting→Area).  
  - Idempotency key: hash(meetingUID + task text).  
- Optional: add a **Notion Button*

threads.title: It includes:
threads.excerpt:
- **Decision register**: add a simple Decisions DB; MCP can append decisions parsed from Minutes (“Decided: …”) with a relation back to Meeting & Project.  
- **Compliance snapshot**: a rollup in Proj

threads.title: 6) Import `postman_collection.json` and hit **Ingest Email** →...
threads.excerpt:
6) Import `postman_collection.json` and hit **Ingest Email** → **Ingest Transcript**. You’ll see tasks generated and linked back to the meeting.

How this maps to your vision:
- Central Meetings hub a

learnings.summary:

learnings.details:
1:8765/mcp/openmemory/sse
```
- If it now shows a “ping” stream (a wall of lines every ~15 seconds), you’re fixed. - Once the mount is fixed, the container will always read/write to C:// going forward. I can then give you **exact before/after lines** so you fix the drive letter and the `/ceo` issue in one go
